item.title: Final Fantasy 9 Remake Might be ‘On Ice’, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
A reliable insider has speculated that development of the Final Fantasy 9 Remake may have been put on hold for the time being.

Final Fantasy 9 Remake’s development has gone through several significant hurdles since we first heard about it. Most recently, we were told earlier this year that the game’s development is ‘in trouble’ and there’s a chance of it being cancelled. Now, more news that fans will not be happy about has surfaced online.

Final Fantasy 9 Remake’s Future is Unknown

Recently, NateTheHate was asked on X (formerly Twitter) whether he had heard anything new about Final Fantasy 9 Remake’s plans. The insider replied that, for now, he assumes “the game is on ice” and that development may have been paused for the title. Moreover, the post states that it is “unknown” whether Square Enix will decide to “return to it or not.” Seems like Final Fantasy 9’s remake is in real trouble.

Things seemed to be looking bright for Final Fantasy 9 Remake earlier this year, when rumours started to heat up with the new website launch for the 25th Anniversary. A few days later, it seemed like Square Enix was also teasing the title, as they posted a quote from the original game’s ending. However, since then we have only been receiving bad news, with it seeming like FF9 remake will never see the light of day.

In other news, Final Fantasy 7 Remake Twin Pack Physical Edition pre-orders are now available for PlayStation 5. Additionally, Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part’s development remains unaffected by Xbox’s lack of memory. What are your thoughts on Final Fantasy 9 Remake’s development being put on hold? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Xbox president confirming that Series X/S successors are in development. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1585: Hints And Answer For October 21, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1585 for October 21, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 21, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1585 gives most players a challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it just a bit easier than October 20’s 5.2-guess average.

General Wordle Hints For October 21

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word contains two vowels.
  • Hint 2: It starts with D.
  • Hint 3: It relates to cleansing or removing something harmful.
  • Hint 4: You might do this after overindulging or being exposed to toxins.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1585 for October 21, 2025

Starter Words For October 21, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • TONED
  • EXALT
  • BOXED

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1585 On October 21, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: DETOX

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1584 on October 20, 2025:

Answer: LIMBO

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1585?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 22 will be Wordle Game #1586.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Xbox President Confirms Series X/S Successors Are in Development
item.content:encoded:
Xbox President has confirmed that their next-gen hardware is in development, which means Series X/S successors are on the way.

Xbox has been going strong with its ‘This is an Xbox’ campaign, bringing its services to all possible platforms. They have already entered the handheld business successfully with the launch of ROG Xbox Ally X and are now looking at bringing Xbox to cars with their new partnership with LG.

With so many platforms being addressed by Xbox, many players were wondering whether their next mainline consoles are getting any attention. Fortunately, the president has stated that development is already on, and they have reached the prototype and design stage of things.

Xbox Series X/S Successors Are in the Prototyping and Designing Stage

During a new interview with Variety (via The Gamer), Xbox President Sarah Bond was asked whether they are still going to make in-house consoles, to which she replied, confirming that the successors of Series X/S are in development.

Bond stated that they are “100% looking at making things in the future.” Their next-gen hardware is already in development, and the team has “been looking at prototyping, designing.” The president also spoke about the AMD partnership around the next-gen consoles.

The Xbox President added that they saw a chance with the ROG Xbox Ally X to “innovate in a new way and to bring gamers another choice, in addition to our next-gen hardware.” Bond spoke about “listening to what players and creators want” and bulding thing when “there is demand for innovation.”

Bond concluded by talking but more innovation that is too come, including towards “further optimizing the experience” for handhelds, scaling out the compatability program, bringing more benefits and improvements, and offering more features to people that give them “more choices and more games.”

In other news, Microsoft is reportedly moving Surface manufacturing out of China and could do the same with Xbox later. Additionally, here’s Insider Gaming’s Asus ROG Xbox Ally X review. What are your thoughts on Xbox Series X/S receiving successors? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Fortnite leak claiming that a Springfield map is coming in a Simpsons-themed crossover. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: How Long To Beat Ninja Gaiden 4? Game Length Explained
item.content:encoded:
Ninja Gaiden 4 is anything but a pushover. Team Ninja has once again concocted another brutal affair, sure to have you pulling out your hair for hours. If you’re wondering how many hours exactly, we can run through Ninja Gaiden 4’s game length and expected playtime for you.

Team Ninja finally returned to its legendary franchise after a few years away. Ninja Gaiden 4 carries on Ryu Hayabusa’s journey and brings back the PTSD instilled by over 30 years of almost hilariously difficult NG games. Don’t get it twisted, we welcome the challenge, and NG games offer a level of challenge not even some Souls games can match!

Ninja Gaiden 4 looks to be a violent return to form. If you’re curious as to how much content is in the game, we’ve got all the answers you need.

How Many Hours To Beat Ninja Gaiden 4?

Team Ninja Director Masakazu Hirayama has said an initial playthrough on normal difficulty should take you “15 to 20 hours.”

Firstly, Ninja Gaiden 4 on a ‘normal’ difficulty is the equivalent of other games essentially being on hard—on steroids. Your mileage will vary when it comes to Hirayama’s window—through NextPlay. If you’re well-versed in hack ‘n’ slash games and used to the difficulty of every combat encounter, then this is a realistic timeframe.

If you’re unfamiliar with Ninja Gaiden and intense action games such as these, your runtime might lean toward the 20-hour window, and beyond. Whereas if you make use of NG 4’s difficulty settings, you might even clock in at just under 15 hours!

There’s plenty of choice.

How Long is a Ninja Gaiden 4 Full Completionist Run?

A completionist run of Ninja Gaiden 4 could feasibly take you 50-100 hours-plus, and there’s a good chance that most people will never be able to complete Ninja Gaiden 4 at all!

If we’re talking about doing everything in Nnja Gaiden 4, this means beating all the extra Missions, Challenges, achieving full weapon mastery, and beating all difficulty levels.

The reason this can take upwards of 100 hours—borderline until the end of time itself—is because of Master Ninja mode. If you go through the full Ninja Gaiden 4 trophy list, you’ll see that “Way of the Master Ninja” requires you to “Complete the game on MASTER NINJA difficulty.”

If this is anything like previous games, expect enemies to kill you in barely any hits, insta-kill you with grab attacks, and attack you whilst you’re attacking other enemies—and even if you’re in the air! It’s beyond brutal. It’s sadistic, but a sickeningly good time for Ninja Gaiden enthusiasts.

Please, please let us know if you intend to do everything. Have you beaten any Ninja Gaiden games on Master Ninja difficulty (or the equivalent setting) in the past? Now’s the time to brag through the Insider Gaming Discord.

For even more Ninja Gaiden 4 coverage here at IG, check out its Early Access eligibility, and if it’s free to play on Xbox Game Pass.

item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Wild Zone 2 Spawns & Alpha Pokémon Locations
item.content:encoded:
There are plenty of Pokémon to encounter in Pokémon Legends: Z-A across Lumiose City, with Wild Zones having different spawns for Pokémon. For all the details on Wild Zone 2, we’ve got you covered.

Wild Zone 2 may be accessible very early in the story, but it’s well worth hunting for new additions to your party here as there are three Pokémon that can be evolved to unlock Mega Evolutions later on, so adding them to your ranks early on is advised to increase their levels in anticipation for battles.

If you’re on the hunt for a specific Pokémon, here are the details on everything you can find in Wild Zone 2 in Pokémon Legends: Z-A.

Wild Zone 2 in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is available to explore after you complete Main Mission 5, and is one of the earliest areas you will be able to explore.

There are six Pokémon species in total to find and catch to earn the golden crown for fully discovering the Pokémon in Wild Zone 2, earning a chunk of points towards Mable’s Research rewards.

The table below shows all Pokémon that spawn in Wild Zone 2, the time of day required, and notes on the specific location where they can be found.

There is one spawn point for Alpha Pokémon in Wild Zone 2, with the Pokémon that appears depending on the time of day.

The locked spawn point for the Alpha Pokémon is located on the right-hand side of the zone from the fast-travel point, accessible via stepping stones from the top-right of the zone.

Other Pokémon in Wild Zone 2 can spawn as Alpha Pokémon, however, as every spawn has a chance of appearing as an Alpha. However, there are guaranteed spawns that can be farmed for valuable resources like EXP Candies.

All the details you need on alpha Pokémon in Wild Zone 2 are below.

Which Alpha Pokémon have you caught to be members of your party in Pokémon Legends: Z-A? Share your team in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon Legends: Z-A, learn how to get your hands on Mega Chesnaught, and take a look at how to evolve Inkay into Malamar.
